means: 以贬抑的口吻，以轻视的态度

sentence.Network_en: No one spoke disparagingly of her father in her hearing.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人在她跟前说过她父亲的坏话。

sentence.Network_en: Do not talk disparagingly about your company in public.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要公开诋毁你的公司。

sentence.Network_en: These mythological figures are described disparagingly as belonging only to a story.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些神话人物被轻蔑地描述为“仅在传说中出现”的人物.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... disparaging 蔑视的 disparagingly 以贬抑的口吻 disparate 全异的.
一起来读阿加莎 1 命案目睹记 Chapter 1... ... tweed： 斜纹软呢大衣 disparagingly： 轻蔑地 plush： 丝绒的.
态度-的英语翻译-bab.la词典 ... 不妥协态度 intransigence 以轻视的态度 disparagingly 奇异的(指态度 bizarre.
Starbucks hip among S. Korean women_高级精读 ... ambivalence: 矛盾心理 disparagingly: 蔑视地 hip: 时髦的.

list.abs: some people just suspiciously or disparagingly looked at us .有的人则会投来怀疑甚至蔑视的眼光。

entry.def: If you are disparaging about someone or something, or make disparaging comments about them, you say things which show that you do not have a good opinion of them.

example.ex: He was critical of the people, disparaging of their crude manners...
example.tran: 他对那些人很有看法，看不起他们粗俗的举止。

example.ex: The Minister was alleged to have made disparaging remarks about the rest of the Cabinet.
example.tran: 据说这位部长发表了一些贬低其他内阁成员的言论。

sentences.sentence: "these mythological figures are described disparagingly as belonging `only to a story'"

auth_sentence.content: "He died for something no one asked him to do," says Thomas, a little disparagingly.
auth_sentence.res_content: "He died for something no one asked him to do," says Thomas, a little disparagingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "He died for something no one asked him to do," says Thomas, a little disparagingly.

auth_sentence.content: Residents speak disparagingly of the provincial government's past pledges to build a number of clinics in the region.
auth_sentence.res_content: Residents speak disparagingly of the provincial government's past pledges to build a number of clinics in the region.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Residents speak disparagingly of the provincial government's past pledges to build a number of clinics in the region.

auth_sentence.content: Chinese media reports were devoid Friday of any of this past criticism and instead referred disparagingly to Gadhafi as a madman.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chinese media reports were devoid Friday of any of this past criticism and instead referred disparagingly to Gadhafi as a madman.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chinese media reports were devoid Friday of any of this past criticism and instead referred disparagingly to Gadhafi as a madman.
